intro: Cyrtandra triflora var. lysiosepala, commonly known as the Hawaiian yellow ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct, fragrant scent. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists and horticulturalists alike.
